_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Kinds of expression that lead to bad con: They say they’ve seen something, but they haven’t.
They say they’ve heard something, but they haven’t.
They say they’ve thought something, but they haven’t.
They say they’ve known something, but they haven’t.
Kinds of expression that lead to good co: They say they haven’t seen something, and they haven’t.
They say they haven’t heard something, and they haven’t.
They say they haven’t thought something, and they haven’t.
They say they haven’t known something, and they haven’t.
